text:
87 yo male adm [**12-4**] with NSTEMI w/ new diastolic CHF in setting of
   GIB. MI medically managed. IV lasix gtt for CHF, now resolved per CXR.
   Sent to [**Hospital Ward Name 383**] 3 for a few days until [**12-11**] when temp spiked to 104 PR. Pt
   found to have C-diff colitis. Abd CT with severe pancolitis versus
   walled-off bowel perforation. Surgery following- no need for urgent
   bowel surgery. NPO until further notice for bowel rest.  Pt still
   awaiting PICC placement for TPN. IV nurse [**First Name (Titles) **] [**Last Name (Titles) 1892**] today and placed
   PICC, however CXR shows line in coiled.  LINE LEFT IN PLACE- DO NOT
   USE! To be advanced in IR tomorrow [**12-17**].  Has not eaten in at least 5
   days. Spoke with team who ordered PPN until PICC placed for TPN.
   Tachycardia/ Hypertension
   Assessment:
   S/P NSTEMI this admission. HR 70s-80s at rest, increased to 100 w/
   activity. BP 130s-180s/70s.   These measurements in setting of
   withholding PO cardiac meds for STRICT NPO status and IV lopressor 10mg
   Q 4hours.
   Action:
   Team increased dose to 20mg IV lopressor Q4 hours.
   Response:
   Resting HR down to low 70s. BP still labile 130-160s/70s.
   Plan:
   Continue to monitor VS. Has only had one dose of lopressor 20mg IV.  If
   HTN persists, check with about possibly adding another [**Doctor Last Name **].
   C. difficile infection (C Diff, Cdiff Colitis, Clostridium Difficile)
   Assessment:
   4 liquid, yellow mucous-like stools today with streaking on sheets in
   between. Perineal skin intact. Afebrile. WBC improved to 16 from 23.
   Abdomen firm, distended. Hyperactive BSx4 quad.
   Action:
   Continue IV flagyl Q8 hours, PO vanco q 6 hours.
   Response:
   Decreasing # of stools. Afebrile.
   Plan:
   Continue to monitor.
   Altered mental status (not Delirium)
   Assessment:
   Alert and oriented to person/ place/ time. Occasional forgetfulness.
   Much improved MS now compared to when febrile a few days ago.
   Action:
   Bed alarms at all times, chair alarmed when OOB. Safety precautions.
   Reoriented as needed.
   Response:
   Remained safe throughout shift. Improved confusion.
   Plan:
   Continue safety precautions.
   Malnutrition
   Assessment:
   Pt without food x 5 days. First limited by new dysphasia in setting of
   altered MS, now with new questionable bowel perforation so Strict NPO
   and nothing per rectum  per surgery team until further notice.
   Action:
   Team alerted of concern re: malnourishment.  PICC line ordered for TPN-
   IV nurse [**First Name (Titles) **] [**Last Name (Titles) 1892**] and placed PICC, however coiled per Xray.  Line
   left in L AC until IR can repair tomorrow.  Team alerted- ordered PPN.
   Response:
   PPN initiated at 1700.
   Plan:
   PPN for now. To IR tomorrow for PICC, then start TPN.
